content: hohoho copyright © general hogbuffer 2011 page 1 this a fairly straight forward christmas ornamental sock it can be done in as many colours as you like but i have restricted myself just to two shades of red and green plus white to keep it christ- massy the patterns are all taken or adapted from a variety of cross stitch books with alpine motifs if you have done stranded knitting before you should have no problems the big deer chart is the only one with float bigger than 5 stitches so i would recommend you weave them in occasionally but take care that you ot always weave the same stitch in each row as this will create a ridge on the front of the knitting like most stranded knitting this will improve with blocking providing you have not used a 100% synthetic yarn in that case you better knit very evenly size as this doesn t have to fit anybody size or guage can be whatever you want it to be hurrah material i have used dk yarns in 5 different colours but this would also be a good project to use lots and lots of leftovers needle size i have knitted them in 3 5 mm which is a size smaller than you would normally use for dk weight to get a slightly denser fabric let s face it this stocking will be loaded to the max with goodies so you want to make sure it can hold its shape you should also have 2 dpns in the same size further requirements - tapestry needle - waste yarn in the same weight as your main yarn - cup of tea and some biscuits anyone hohoho page 2 hem cast on 80 sts with waste yarn and join into a round taking care not to twist the cast on k 1 round p 1 round k1 round join col a and k 13 rounds change to col b work picot edge as follows k1 round k2 decrease yo repeat to end of round k1 round change back to col a and k 1 round work 12 rounds in stripe pattern k1 with a k1 with b repeat to end undo the waste yarn and collect live stitches onto spare needle s take special care that you do not shift the beginning of the round and that you have the full 80 sts picked up with a knit the first stitch from your needle together with the first stitch from the spare needle keep going all around until you have joined the hem completely you should be back with just 80 sts ready to start the leg this join was indicated by the first green rw on the leg chart leg following the leg chart starting from the bottom knit the whole of the leg in stranded knitting us- ing the colours as indicated or substituting your own if you prefer the chart is for the whole leg so you will
